step1.sentence: The old theater has been on borrowed time ever since the city announced plans to demolish it next spring.

step2.story: The startup's runway was nearly exhausted, and everyone in the office knew they were on borrowed time. The founder worked through the night, pitching to one last investor in a desperate attempt to keep the dream alive.

step3.story: Dr. Ellis had told Marcus six months ago that without a transplant, he was living on borrowed time. Yet every morning he still rose before dawn, brewed his coffee, and sat on the porch to watch the sun climb over the hills. He wasn't being reckless — he simply refused to let the clock define how he spent his days. His daughter visited every weekend now, and they talked about things they had never dared to say before. When the call finally came that a donor match had been found, Marcus realized the borrowed time had given him something irreplaceable: the life he should have been living all along.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 빌린 시간 위에 있다는 뜻으로, 원래 주어진 시간을 이미 초과하여 존재하고 있음을 나타낸다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 사람이나 사물이 곧 끝날 것으로 예상됨에도 불구하고 아직 존재하거나 지속되고 있을 때 사용한다. 건강 위기, 노후화된 시스템, 무너지기 직전의 조직 등에 폭넓게 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 19세기 영어에서 유래한 표현으로, 원래 갚아야 할 빚처럼 언젠가는 반납해야 할 '빌린 시간'이라는 개념에서 비롯되었다. 죽음이나 종말을 피할 수 없지만 잠시 유예된 상태를 묘사하는 데 쓰이기 시작했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 위기감보다 더 깊은 체념과 긴박감이 담겨 있으며, 종종 비극적이거나 비장한 분위기를 풍긴다. 중립적이거나 긍정적인 맥락보다는 부정적·심각한 상황에 주로 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Everyone knew the century-old bridge was on borrowed time.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 모두가 그 100년 된 다리가 얼마 남지 않았다는 것을 알고 있었다.
